page.title: 12EDUCATION
page.content: There is a small rural primary school. It is a Group 2 school with approximately 55-65 pupils drawn from a wide area and brought to the school by school transport.No public transport is available. The school, built in 1929, comprises two classrooms for Juniors in the main school, and a seperate building for Infants. There is a swimming pool and a small playing field. Subjects taught:{English}(diary, handwriting, reading, S.R.A., poetry, stories);{Maths; Science; Topic and {Project work; History; Geography}(map reading);{Music; Health Education; {Scripture and Assembly; Cooking;Art (painting, drawing, printing);{Craft (needlework, pottery, canework, games making);{Games}(cricket, rounders, football, netball, athletics, swimming, camping);{Computer work.
